Constructor Detail

SquareMatrixOps

public SquareMatrixOps()
Method Detail

inverse_lt

private static Matrix inverse_lt(Matrix tri)
This is a numericall stable algorithm for computing the inverse of a lower triangular matrix. It is called by inverse(), and has that the given matrix is square, triangular and invertible as a precondition. It is numerically stable.

Parameters:
tri - the square, nonsingular, lower triangular matrix to invert
Returns:
the inverse of the given matrix, which is also lower triangular

inverse

public static Matrix inverse(Matrix m)
                      throws NotSquareException,
                             SingularMatrixException
Computes the inverse of the matrix via Gauss-Jordan elimination

Parameters:
m - the matrix of which the inverse is computed
Returns:
the corresponding inverse matrix
Throws:
NotSquareException - the matrix is not square
SingularMatrixException - the given matrix is singular/not invertible

                                 throws NotSquareException
Returns the determinant of this matrix in O(n^3) time complexity

Parameters:

Returns:
the determinant of the matrix
Throws:

trace

public static ComplexNumber trace(Matrix m)
                           throws NotSquareException
Returns the trace of the matrix, the sum of the diagonal elements

Parameters:

Returns:
the trace of the matrix
Throws:
NotSquareException - the given matrix is not square

getForm

private static int getForm(Matrix m)
This is a helper method for the QR algorithm. It finds the 'form' of the matrix, which is either a row of zeros on the bottom except the rightmost element, two rows of zeros on the bottom except for the rightmost 2x2 block, or neither

Parameters:
m - the matrix whose 'form' we compute
Returns:
1, 2 or 0, with respect to the definition given in the description

eigenvalues

public static ComplexNumber[] eigenvalues(Matrix m)
Returns a list of the eigenvalues of the matrix by computing QR similarity transforms until the matrix converges to a triangular matrix (i.e. implements the shifted QR algorithm)

Parameters:
m - the matrix whose eigenvalues we compute
Returns:
an array containing the eigenvalues of the matrix
Throws:
NotSquareException - the given matrix is not square

eigenvectors

public static Vector[] eigenvectors(Matrix m)
                             throws NotSquareException
Computes the normalized eigenvectors

Parameters:
m - the matrix whose eigenvectors are computed
Returns:
an array of normalized eigenvectors for the matrix
Throws:
NotSquareException - the given matrix is not square

eigenvectors

public static Vector[] eigenvectors(Matrix m,
                                    ComplexNumber[] evals)
Computes the normalized eigenvectors of the matrix corresponding to certain eigenvalues

Parameters:
m - the matrix whose eigenvectors are being computed
evals - the list of eigenvalues to compute the associated eigenvectors of
Returns:
an array of normalized eigenvectors for the matrix
Throws:
NotSquareException - the given matrix is not square

the matrix raised to the specified power
Throws:
